pros.description: The location is silent, relaxing, and free from significant noise or disturbances.
Aesthetic appeal of the surrounding landscape, nature, and environment.
Excellent aesthetic views of the horizon, sunsets, or surrounding scenery.
Technical environmental quality of darkness, ideal for stargazing or astrophotography.
Positive human interaction with owners or employees.
Staff members speak multiple languages to assist international guests.
Self-service kiosks or machines that support multiple language options.
Provision of valuable advice about the area, hidden gems, or navigation.
Sanitary blocks or common areas are in good repair and hygienic.
Showers provide reliable hot water and strong flow.
Washing machines and dryers are present and functional.
Individual spots are large and offer privacy from neighbors.
The ground is even, requiring no ramps or leveling.
The parking surface is asphalt, concrete, or solid paving (good for heavy vehicles).
Trees or structures provide protection from direct sunlight.
The cost is perceived as a good deal or reasonably priced.
The location accepts camping discount cards like ACSI.
Costs are clearly stated without hidden fees.
Direct or very close access to a beach, lake, or river.
Walking or short distance to shops and town amenities.
Proximity to hiking paths, forest trails, or cycling routes.
Nearby availability of groceries or gas stations.
Fresh bread can be ordered or is delivered onsite.
Availability of prepared food or drinks directly on property.
Power hookups are stable and provide sufficient amperage.
Clean drinking water is easily accessible for tanks.
Working stations for emptying grey water and chemical toilets.
Site provides a fast and stable wireless internet connection.
Excellent cellular data reception (4G/5G) across the site.
Physical security like fences, gates, or cameras.
Subjective feeling of safety due to the neighborhood or guests.
Site welcomes dogs and provides bins or exercise areas.
Safe spaces or equipment for children to play.
Entrance and roads suitable for long or heavy motorhomes.
24/7 access via machines or easy self-check-in.
Recreational options like pools or organized classes.
The place has a distinct artistic, ecological, or creative feeling.
Active participation: milking animals, harvesting, or gardening.
Specialized gas refilling services on or near site.
Site is near historical monuments or cultural significance.
Not an official campsite, but authorities are known to overlook stays without fines.
Explicit positive mention of the local town/mayor for providing the area.
Water or electricity are available directly at the individual spot.
Ability to buy farm goods, wine, or crafts from the source.
Positive feedback that does not fit into specific categories.
Opportunity to participate in wine tastings, tours, or stay directly within a vineyard.
Presence of ecological facilities such as dry/compost toilets and outdoor solar showers.
Audible presence of nature such as frogs, birds, or other wildlife (often cited as a positive immersive experience).
On-site equipment available for washing the vehicle or bicycles.
Stay fee includes an ecological contribution, such as planting a tree.
General praise without specific details, e.g., "Great stay," "Lovely spot," "We will be back."

cons.description: Pollution from roads, flight paths, or railways.
Disturbances from barking, livestock, or loud neighbors.
Loud music or social gatherings disrupting sleep.
Lack of maintenance, full bins, or unhygienic areas.
Equipment is non-functional, falling apart, or very old.
Water is uncomfortably cold or flow is too weak.
Ground is not level, requiring ramps for the vehicle.
Surface becomes difficult to manage in rain or extreme dry.
Area is open to the sun, leading to excessive heat.
Too many trees/branches blocking solar panels or satellite internet (Starlink).
The road to the site is challenging for driving.
Physical height barriers like low tree branches, arches, or gates.
Layout makes it hard to turn or position the vehicle.
Situational issue: too many people/vehicles present right now.
Design issue: the pitches are physically too small or narrow.
The cost is higher than expected for the quality.
Inconvenience of no cards or complex payment rules.
Missing basic services like toilets or water.
Negative interaction with personnel.
Restrictive hours or complex arrival rules (e.g. arrive after 6PM only).
Internet provided by the site is slow or cuts out.
Poor cellular reception (dead zones) on site.
Suspicious individuals or known history of break-ins.
Risk of being moved on or fined by local police.
Problems with mosquitoes, flies, or industry odors.
Rubbish left on ground or overflowing bins.
Power hookups frequently fail/cannot handle appliances.
Water is unsafe to drink or refill is extremely slow.
Hard to find entrance/spots due to lack of signs.
Far from infrastructure, requiring significant driving for needs.
Excessive rules regarding behavior or stay duration (e.g. max 24h).
Proximity to power lines, antennas, or towers.
Behavior from locals or long-term residents that makes others feel unwelcome.
Access blocked by roadworks, events, or season closure.
Chemical toilet emptying exists, but no grey water drainage.
Requires non-standard connectors for water or power.
Waste stations are unhygienic, hard to access, or poorly located.
Other campers Disrupting the experience (generators, bad parking).
Spots physically too short or narrow for motorhomes.
Surface is loose sand; high risk of sinking/getting stuck.
Exposed to high wind; unsafe for awnings or roof tents.
Natural sounds (waves, intense wind) loud enough to disrupt sleep.
Negative feedback that does not fit specific categories.
Access requires driving a significant distance on gravel, dirt, or washboard tracks (risk for standard suspensions).
Toilets or showers are available but locked/closed during the night or winter season.
Feedback indicates the location no longer exists, is permanently blocked, or has been removed.
Terrain requires a four-wheel drive vehicle or high ground clearance to navigate safely.
Potable water is safe but has a strong unpleasant taste of chlorine, bleach, or iron.
Parking is located on a toll road with a maximum stay limit (e.g., 12h) before heavy fines apply.
Entry is barred by a gate that requires downloading a specific app to book and open.
General complaints without specific details, e.g., "Terrible" or "Not recommended"
